Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sitting on the roof of the office building] Well, I'm moving to Colorado to start my new life with Holly. Just up here, getting used to the altitude.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking up] Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've got a treat for you!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh, thank you. Like a butler.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Colorado specialty, Rocky Mountain Oysters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Michael takes one and bites] Oh, these do not taste like oysters.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [angrily] That's because they're Not oysters, they're bull testicles! I cut them off fresh this morning! [Michael spits it out] Hah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sick freak! What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you? I'm the sick freak? After what you did? You expect to be buttled? You didn't recommend me?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't own Dunder Mifflin, okay? [Dwight scoffs] The job was not mine to give. [sighs] Look, I need your advice on something. I am told that there are bears in the Rockies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where did you hear that? Obvious XM Radio?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I was just thinking that maybe I should keep a salami in my pocket...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...in order to feed the bears.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Especially if you think that life would be better without Legs!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Black Bears can smell a salami at five miles Michael, what are you thinking?! And they run faster than a horse, so if you were thinking about outrunning one on a horse I would try a cheetah. You, in tight pants, Michael, are a salami to a Black Bear. Do you understand? [Michael nods in agreement] You're like a giant walking salami!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, so no salami in the pants. How about a pepperoni?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Any kind of meat that you can possibly name!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [with Michael in his office] You're not gonna take all these toys are you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hm?

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I mean you don't have a job lined up, so it's not like you have a desk to put 'em on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well I have interviews.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: That's nice. [reaches and a grabs a toy truck] How 'bout that truck? Can I have this little truck? I was thinking I might... glue a stapler on top. Or put a hole here, stick pens in it. [Michael gives an obviously fake smile] You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes, you know what? Take my favorite truck. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: You know what? Uh, it's your last couple days, I'm gonna get out of your hair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh you don't, that's-

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I will be in the break room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That sounds good. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Dead man walking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sad? No, no, no. I don't leave 'til tomorrow, so... Tomorrow I will be a wreck.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [sees Andy walk into the Men's Room and follows him in] Stay away from Erin! [cornering him in the bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I'm your boss!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why don't you, uh, stay away from me?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No, I'm gonna stand where I want. Okay? You don't wanna get on my bad side! I've seen some horrible things! I own over two hundred horror movies!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay! That's so weird! Just go away!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: No! You go away! [storms out, toilet flushes, Jim exits the bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [weak] Hi Tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So you guys are filming people when they go to the bathroom now?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [in the conference room with Pam, Angela, and Meredith] How about cupcakes?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's wrong with cupcakes?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Everything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking in] There they are! Party Planning Committee together again!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well we all wanted to plan your goodbye party. We thought this would be easier.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We thought.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's an experiment.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The three of us have all been chairmen before.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So this is the dream team.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [walking up behind the glass] Hey! What are you saying?!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The dream team... and Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [to Michael] We decided on the ice cream. Mint chocolate chip, your favorite.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah that was a surprise...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, I'm thinking maybe we should get ice cream that everybody'll like. How about vanilla? Let's get vanilla.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [surprised] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Tomorrow I want everyone to have a good time. No drama. And as for today, just a typical day. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Should we get toppings?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you like Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [confused] What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What kind of toppings would you like?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hot fudge?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sounds good. Fudge it up! [all seem surprised at Michael's behavior]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding up his "World's Best Boss Mug"] I bought this for myself. And yesterday, they gave me this. [holds up a Dundie that reads, 'World's Best Boss 2011, Michael G. Scott', throws his mug into the garbage can and places his Dundie at the front of his desk] I still need something to drink out of though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pulls out a list of everyone in the office, then puts it back in his jacket] Attention everyone, before I leave tomorrow I would like to reveal a secret I have kept for over twenty years. A secret about Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Please Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When Phyllis was in high school, she was so... cute. [Phyllis looks relieved] And she still is.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I thought he knew about the baby I gave away.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [holds up mittens she's knitting] Look Michael, it's a going away present so your hands won't get cold.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahh.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's almost done, but you can't get them wet, and they can't be dry-cleaned either. You have to hand wash without water, wring-dry gently, and use a hairdryer on cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hesitantly] Sounds great, I just think it's great. Oh, I have gifts as well! [goes into his office and comes out with a bag] And I will start, by giving the first gift to Phyllis! Phyllis, you are shy and sweet, and you don't often speak your mind, but you should. Because you have great ideas. So Phyllis, I am giving you this, so you can always remember to speak your mind. [presents to her a mouth wind-up chattering toy]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's cute. [plays with it]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley, you love your Sudoku and your puzzles, I bestow upon you, my felt. [gives Stanley a small felt table] May you never lose the fun loving quality in life.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Where's the rest of it, it's got no balls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay... And Andy, Andy who needs confidence that he is a great salesman. I give you, my clients, our ten most important accounts. [other salesmen look outraged]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [angry] Yeah wow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know I'm the worst salesman here right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But you're the best salesman, on the inside.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What does that even mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You sold us all on Andy, a product that nobody wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna lose 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're not gonna lose them.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I promise you that I will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just do your best! I have faith in you.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [as Michael walks away, Stanley whispers angrily to Andy] Gimme those clients!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [to Dwight] Do you believe that?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I've given up expecting Michael to do the right thing. Or the decent thing. Or even the comprehensible thing.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: I used to be obese. Once you've conquered obesity, everything else is easy. Life literally moves in slow motion. I'm not saying I'm superman, but, let me just put it this way. If I were shot in the head, I'm pretty sure everything would be fine. I almost welcome it. [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin, I have something for you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh! [Michael unrolls it to reveal it is a caricature of Kevin as a pig eating pizza]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know who that is?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [rips the poster in half] Don't be a caricature Kevin, never be a caricature. How did that feel when I tore that up?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Better...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good, stand up. [Kevin does so] You will be thin. You Won't drool over pizza like an animal anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You will find love.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm pretty much okay with who I am now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't be. You should never settle for who you are. [moving on] Oscar, Oscar, Oscar! Oscar, you are-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just lost Porter Hardware! I just, I lost 'em!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [quietly groans] Okay, you know what? Just do your best buddy! Okay, Oscar, you are very smart, and you have a gigantic education. And, I think of you as my scarecrow, because you gave me a brain. So that's why I made you this. [takes a sack tied in the upper middle making a crude head, with a face drawn on, obviously the product of poor craftsmanship, Oscar pretends to like it]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you Michael. It's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] It looks like a [more laughing] It looks like it was made by a two year old monkey on a farm! He just accepted, accepted that I put all this work into it! [laughs more] He has the lowest opinion of me, of anybody!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was it just me, or did you think that we were going to have sex at some point?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It was just you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How would you have wanted to do it? Okay, okay. You know what? Inappropriate. I am engaged happily, and you have landed yourself a Senator.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: State Senator.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhmm, bravo!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Brava!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You wanna see some pictures? I just got these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uhm, these are, okay this is us at the theater. And antiquing! Oh, rollerblading.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's that? Who's that guy? [points to second guy in the pictures]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, that's Thomas, Robert's aide.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I guess this could be the one, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Oscar shakes his head no]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [walking into the kitchen, DeAngelo is using the coffee machine to cook chicken covered in melted chocolate] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [hurriedly, while hiding the chocolate covered chicken] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm going to be dropping out on one of our biggest clients this afternoon and I could use some back up.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Let's rip it up homes. [smacks top of the door frame with his hand, leaving a chocolate hand outline]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [Andy walks by with DeAngelo, says quietly after he leaves] Walk away bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Michael is leaving the accounting area] Oh Michael! Where do you want your last pay check sent?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My last pay check?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have an address yet in Colorado?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What town do Holly's parents live in?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not sure, um, Mountainton?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sounds beautiful!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael sits alone eating at the back of the kitchen, Pam comes in with Jim, Creed and Kevin] You should do more stuff like that.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm going to!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Michael] Hey! It's almost your last day, come sit with us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah, I'm almost done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So I'm going to Carbondale this afternoon to get a new bulk shredder.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Finally! That old shredder sucked.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's a good shredder, it just keeps breaking.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, it won't shred magazines.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's not supposed to shred magazines Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I know...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you break the shredder Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, it's just... that old shredder sucks. [Michael looks tearful] Just get one that'll shred magazines.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think any of them are supposed to shred magazines.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [crying] I can't do this. All the channels are gonna be different there. I'm not gonna be able to find my shows. I'm not going to start improv at level one, and I don't think my credits will transfer. Ugh, and you know what? I just figured out where I was supposed to go to vote. [picks World's Best Boss mug out of the trashcan and puts it back on his desk] I gotta call her, and I'm going to tell her, that I cannot come. [dials on his phone]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hello there!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. What is the name of our town?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Boulder. Is something wrong? Are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I just needed to hear your voice.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [Yoda voice] Oh you mean this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yes. [Olive Oyl impression] Yes my hero!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [deep man voice] I'll pay the rent! [Michael laughs] Okay, my mom's looking at me and she has no sense of humor. It's a joke mom!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Ohh, I miss you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well I'll see you tonight. I'll pick you up outside baggage claim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll see you tonight. I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I love you too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hangs up and composes himself] Yes, so I know I told everybody that tomorrow is my last day, but I'm, I'm gonna be leaving tonight. I head to the airport at four. [looks at the list of members of the office, with some names crossed out] And I have said goodbye to half of them.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well you know Michael, I have a brother in Boulder. Rory Flenderson. You should look him up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [grimaces and nods, Toby nods back at him] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [smiling] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks over to Kelly] Kelly! Kelly? Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [doing make up and irritated] What?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If I just went away right now, would that be the best gift that I could give you?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yes! Please! Please go away! And stop using that weird slow voice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Ryan's office, which is illuminated blue] She was once my girl, and she is your girl now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wow. [camera pans over to show that the light is from Michael's St. Pauli Girl Sign, hanging in Ryan's office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: This is... totally unnecessary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're not prone to seizures?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [in conference room with the party planning committee] So Michael said we can do whatever we want cake-wise. What do we want?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [quickly] Erotic.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: See? This is what happens. You can't let a stray dog into the house.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hmm, let's hear here out. I would like to hear more about these cakes. [Angela and Pam look uncomfortable]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I know these Ethiopians that run a cake shop.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good God...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: They make these cakes, they're wild! I mean, they show everything!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't, I don't think we sh-

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I know what you're thinking, but it's not just black, they do it all. And the women on these cakes, they're not just guy's fantasies. They have real, full women. It is refreshing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [stopping her] Okay, don't turn this into some feminist issue.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: As a person who buys a lot of erotic cakes, it feels good to be represented on one.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what, I think we should get some other input.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I think we should do cupcakes. I am one of the few people who looks hot eating a cupcake.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, cupcakes. That's what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No! I'm not cleaning up a bunch of uneaten cupcake bottoms! You know, we don't really care about your opinion. You're just a tie-breaker.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sees Pam walking towards the door of the office] Um, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Michael! I'm just going to go to Carbondale to price some shredders. I'll see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [disappointed] Okay... [Jim is confused]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [walking into the women's bathroom, Gabe storms in after her] Gabe!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I need to talk to you!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You can't be in here. This is a lady's room!

Quote.Speaker: abe
Quote.Text: Erin, I respect your privacy, but I will follow you in here everytime you go if that's what it takes. [Creed walks out of one of the stalls]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Not cool man. [walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I really think you should leave.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Someday, you are going to tell our grandchildren about how their grandfather won you back in a women's room.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Can we talk about this later, I have to go.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Just read the letter under your windshield wiper, it explains everything. Quick one. [leans in for a kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay... [walks out embarrassed]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [on video cam with his brother] Here's the thing Rory, I knew you guys would hit it off in an odd way.

Quote.Speaker: Rory
Quote.Text: I can bring him a welcome basket. I'll surprise him.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Do- Well you should give him a little time to settle in. But-

Quote.Speaker: Rory
Quote.Text: Does he like jams? My shelves are over flowing with preserves.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, no. He hates jams.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walking into Darryl's office] Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like to give you, the only copy, of Somehow I Manage. [hands him a thin black folder] Unfinished. If there's anyone here who can finish it, it's you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's sweet Mike. Let's see here. There's a chapter, called Gum. With one sentence. Everybody likes the guy who offers him a stick of gum.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmhmmm. It's true. Darryl, I have one last wish. I would like to use the bailer.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. Can't let you do that Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No problem. Worth a try.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in warehouse] Darryl said I could use the bailer because I'm leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse Guy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [picks up a basketball and dribbles it away from the basket] Alright guys, well... see ya later warehouse. Catch you on the flippity flip. [throws the ball behind him and misses the basket, tries and misses several more times]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [in car with Andy] okay, so what's our approach? You a veteran? Do I have a month to live? You gonna get married tomorrow? What? [Andy stares blankly] Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I thought we'd just talk about our customer service and exceptional paper quality.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: That's stupid. [laughing. Nervously, Andy laughs with him]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [joking] What do I know?

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [still laughing] What do you know? We gotta get psyched up! Okay? Guy? Let's get psyched! Is there an animal shelter on the way?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [confused] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Awesome! Ani Ani Shelto! Here we come. Do you know how to high-five?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: 'Cause if you do now's the time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [going for it] Alright.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Not while I'm driving.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still trying the backwards basket] Catch you guys- [forklift drives in front of the camera] Catch you guys on the filippity flip. [misses and picks it up again] Flippity flip! [misses again and grabs it back] Flippity flip! [makes it in, gets excited] Really? [composes himself] Okay, see ya guys! [walks away, containing his self-pleasure]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [at the animal shelter with Andy] You know how I met Jo Bennett? And got started on my ladder of success?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I don't.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [hands Andy a dog] I'm walking along, out of work. Again. Thinking to myself, 'I only have enough cash to by a sandwich, or get drunk. And I see this guy trying to steal this lady's dog! So I grab the dog. He runs off. She's so grateful, she hires me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awwhh, wow.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Gimme that dog! That's not your dog! [takes the dog from a confused Andy] Yeah! Again.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, okay...

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: Gimme that damn dog you f***ing thief! Don't ever do It again! [Andy nods modestly] You hear me?! [Andy nods again] You feel that energy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mmhmmm.

Quote.Speaker: DeAgnelo
Quote.Text: Wooo! Yeah! [parades in circles with the dog, pretends to whack Andy with it] [giving it to Andy] Okay, again.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know that Gabe is young, and hot and everything. And he's begging me to reconsider, but I... I just think I'm in love with someone else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahhhh...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I wish I knew who my birth mother was, so she could just tell me who to choose.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe neither.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm not attracted to Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin, listen to me. You shouldn't rush into this. At all. And you know why? Because you are beautiful. And you are fun. And you are smart. [Erin is smiling] And when the right guy comes along, you'll know it. You will. [kisses her head] And you know what? You don't need a mom. Because you have my number, and you can call me anytime.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [nods] Extension 147.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: N-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [both chuckling. Michael leaves Erin, looking thoughtful]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [on the phone] You want the 27-26 or the 27-30?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis. Phyllis, are my mittens done?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No. [trying to finish her sale when Michael hangs up the phone] I'm on a sale!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen to me. It's two p.m. From now until four, your priority is knitting. Knit like the wind.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay... [Jim gives a knowing look to the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, I will be leaving tomorrow. [pulls out an envelope from his jacket]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I wanted to give you that. [hands him the envelope] It's a letter of recommendation. [Dwight looks eager. Michael nods to him and walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is gonna be good. [eagerly reading the letter] To whom it may concern. [off to the side] Good, real personal. Thanks Michael. [reading again] The dictionary defines superlative as:

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [opening his trunk excitedly and gets out his paintball gear, takes his gun and looks for Michael, gives up, Michael jumps out of the dumpster shooting, they shoot each other, yell, laugh, and taunt, having a great time]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in the office, crosses Dwight off his list. He has paint in his messed up hair, and is containing his laughter]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [giving his and Andy's pitch to a client] I would just like to start off saying, I have not worked with Mr. Andy Bernard for very long, I can say, is that he is no Michael Scott. I can't sit here and tell you he's gonna be a success. I can't sit here and tell you that he's even the best man for the job. [Andy looks awkward] But I can say this:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael walks into the office, still a mess] Ahh, what happened to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should see the other guy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [smiles knowingly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks at the clock to see it is three o'clock] Jim where is Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uhh, she's still pricing the whatevers. The shredders.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But it is already three o'clock! [Michael leaves, Jim gives a knowing look to the camera]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [walks into a movie theater showing The King's Speech]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in his office talking to Creed, Gabe, and Meredith in that order] Whether you're scared of dying, or dying Alone, or dying drunk in a ditch. Don't be. It's going to be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah I was tripling up. There's not enough time in the day to have a special moment with everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Gabe is still standing in front of Michael's desk] And you, why are you still here.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [sounding hurt] I'm either going to quit today, or stay to make sure that Andy's career is destroyed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you are not going to quit today. For goodness sake, this is not going to be your last day in the office. Everybody gets dumped Gabe. Can I give you a piece of advice? [Gabe nods] A little cover-up on your Adam's apple will make it appear smaller, and make you look less like a transvestite. [Gabe looks awkward and Michael winks]

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [walking out the client's room with Andy] That is cold sir! Absolutely cold. You know what? It was a complete waste of my time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh DeAngelo, I'm, uh. I forgot my bag, so I'll meet you in the car.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [grumbles] Okay whatever.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [walks into the client's office again] Sir, I'd just like to apologize, for that. I could tell you that he has a steel plate in his head, or that he's crazy, but the truth is I think he's just a terrible salesman. And I want you to know, that if you re-up with us, anything you need, day or night, I will be the one to take your call.

Quote.Speaker: Client
Quote.Text: Keep talking.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [on his phone waiting for Andy, next to their car] Yes. Okay, alright. No, well thank you! Alright, take care. [hangs up] You'll never guess, we did it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [laughing] Hey! [they hug] Good job boss!

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: We did it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing in front of his office, sees that it is three forty five] Okay, everybody come on. Conference room five seconds! Let's go! Hurry up, let's do this! [Dwight runs into the conference room. All others follow]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yes, what is this about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is this meeting about?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mmhmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here we are in the conference room. Once again. And I just wanted to call you all here, together, because I have something important. Well there's two things actually. Okay first, I would like a whereabouts on Pam. [Jim looks regretful] And secondly, Phyllis how are those mittens coming? Because I would actually like to bring them home and pack them. I'm leaving for the day at four.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: They're almost done but my knuckles are swelling a little and-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [cutting her off] Well power through the arthritis Phyllis you can do it!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is that it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Umm, hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is that it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [the office looks up expectantly] Ummm... Hm... No. [changing his mind] No. There's a special guest that I would like to invite to say one last goodbye. So here he comes, he's coming right in. [walks out and then back in, now using a Vietnamese accent] Oh hi everybody, it's Ping! [the office groans] And I'm here to say goodbye to all you wonderful people! Thank you everybody! You've been so wonderful! [only Kevin is laughing. Stanley tries to leave. Michael hugs him] I ruv you all! I ruv you very much!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, can I talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. [Ping accent] Be right out!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [brings Michael into his office] So I've been meaning to tell ya, I wanna take you out for lunch. For your last day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sad] Ohh...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you think? Tomorrow? Lunch, you and me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [holding back tears] Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not leaving tomorrow. You're leaving today right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, so that's it huh? Just, four o'clock and you are gone for good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why am I so sad? Am I doing the wrong thing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely not. It's just that sometimes... goodbyes are a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pulls out a recorder and speaks softly into it] T-Shirt idea, goodbyes stink. Okay, alright. So. James Halpert. [starts to cry] You started with this company, as a fine young man...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what I think we should do? I think we should just save the goodbyes for tomorrow. At lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And then tomorrow, I can tell you... what a great boss, you turned out to be. The best boss I ever had. [Jim is holding back tears too]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hears a taxi honking] Oh shoot! That's my cab.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen Michael, I really... I did text Pam, but...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, it's okay. Just, give her a hug. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [shakes Michael's hand] I will see you, tomorrow at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am looking forward to lunch. And hearing about what a great boss I am.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [chuckles] You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... [crosses Jim off his list] Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh no, they're still not done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no, let me see. [picks up the mostly knitted mittens] Oh Phyllis, nice try. I love 'em. [waves goodbye to her with the mittens] [Michael begins walking out the office, he takes one last look at all his friends to see them working, and Jim looking back, teary eyed]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [drinking from Michael's World's Best Boss mug] See ya tomorrow boss!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Later guys. [leaves the office]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got almost everybody. So... Holly's my family now. [you see video of Michael getting into the cab, and driving off. As the cab leaves, Pam drives in] She's my family. The babies that I make with her, will be my children. The people that you work with, are just... when you get down to it... your very best friends. They say, on your deathbed, you never wish you spent more time at the office. But I will. Gotta be a lot better than a deathbed. [You see Michael getting out and entering the airport, and going through security] I actually don't understand deathbeds. I mean, who would buy that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [putting his shoes back on, talking to the camera crew] Well, I guess this is it. Hey will you guys let me know if this ever airs? Thank you. Alright... Oh! [pulls out his mic from his shirt] This is gonna feel so good, getting this thing off my chest. [he hands them the body mic, when he speaks it is inaudible now] That's what she said! [waves goodbye and walks off to his gate, halfway there Pam comes running up to him and they hug for a while. They say their goodbyes to each other, and Michael walks off for good]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [watching Michael's plane take off. Crying and has smeared make up on] No he wasn't sad. He was full of hope. About Colorado, and he was hoping to get an upgrade as an award's member. And he said he was just real excited to get home and see Holly.

Quote.Speaker: DeAngelo
Quote.Text: [all are in the conference room for Michael's party. Michael isn't there. Jim gives the camera a knowing look] Well if he's not gonna make it at least we should go ahead and eat the cake. [Kevin nods] I for one love the corners. [cuts a corner piece, picks it up with his bare hands, and takes a bite] Why'd I just do that? It's not even that good. I don't even want it. I had cake for lunch. [throws the piece in the garbage] No, you know what? I've been good. I deserve this. [grabs a piece from another corner. The office groans] What am I doing? [chucks it into the trashcan] Come on DeAngelo! [DeAngelo tries to lick the cake, everybody yells no]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Uh oh... [Jim, tearful, nods]
